page.title: 17ROADS / ST EVAL AIRFIELD
page.content: The roads stay the same,but lines now stop and telegraph poles begin to appear.There is barbed wire on one side of the road on top of the hedge. This is to keep the animals from going onto the road. The roads now get a little wider and there are a few bridges.The yellow lines appear again and you pass more houses.A few bits of pavement appear.The road leads into St Mawgan.{ST EVAL AIR FIELD}was used in World War 2 for refueling,landing and taking off.The planes were Spitfires,Sunderlands,Bothas, Wellingtons,Mosqitoes and Gnats. Occasionally a Beaufort would take off from the airfield.A headquarters is still standing and it is used as an R.A.F. training unit.The Airfield is used for motorbike and car racing.You can tell this by the shattered glass. There are a few electricity pylons.
